unnormalised: The CBSE class 10th results were declared yesterday, on 15/05/2024, bringing both joy and disappointment to students across the country. This year, over 20 lakh students appeared for the exams held in March and April. While the overall pass percentage remained consistent at around 93%, several schools in metro cities like Delhi and Mumbai reported a higher number of students scoring above 90%.
normalised: The C-B-S-E class tenth results were declared yesterday, on fifteenth May two thousand and twenty four, bringing both joy and disappointment to students across the country. This year, over twenty lakh students appeared for the exams held in March and April. While the overall pass percentage remained consistent at around ninety three percent, several schools in metro cities like Delhi and Mumbai reported a higher number of students scoring above ninety percent.

unnormalised: Among the high achievers was Aisha Khan from Modern School, Delhi, who secured a perfect score of 500/500. In an interview, she mentioned that consistent study habits and seeking guidance from her teachers helped her ace the exams. However, reports also surfaced about some students feeling stressed due to the high competition and pressure to score well. Many students are now gearing up for admissions to class 11th, with cut-offs expected to be high for popular streams like Science and Commerce.
normalised: Among the high achievers was Aisha Khan from Modern School, Delhi, who secured a perfect score of five hundred divided by five hundred. In an interview, she mentioned that consistent study habits and seeking guidance from her teachers helped her ace the exams. However, reports also surfaced about some students feeling stressed due to the high competition and pressure to score well. Many students are now gearing up for admissions to class eleventh, with cut-offs expected to be high for popular streams like Science and Commerce.

unnormalised: The CBSE board has advised students not to get disheartened by their scores and to focus on their strengths. Re-evaluation applications will be accepted until 25/05/2024. Meanwhile, students who didn't clear the exams will have a second chance to appear in the compartment exams scheduled for July '24. The board has also made counseling services available to students struggling with exam-related stress; students may dial the toll-free number 1800-11-8004 for assistance.
normalised: The C-B-S-E board has advised students not to get disheartened by their scores and to focus on their strengths. Re-evaluation applications will be accepted until twenty fifth May two thousand and twenty four. Meanwhile, students who didn't clear the exams will have a second chance to appear in the compartment exams scheduled for July twenty twenty four. The board has also made counseling services available to students struggling with exam-related stress; students may dial the toll-free number one eight hundred, eleven, eight thousand and four for assistance.
